page.title: 14Leisure Activity in The Lee
page.content: {Riding}is one of the most popular local activities. A large number of young people belong to The Pony Club, which organises days for instruction & practice. The Old Berkley Hunt meets in the area twice during the season, & many adults ride for leisure all year. 2 places keep horses at livery, & there are many in private keeping. Being part of an A.O.N.B., the area is used a lot by{walkers.}The many footpaths are well-marked by the Chiltern Society; but unfortunately riders make some footpaths impassable to walkers at some seasons. The woods, owned by the Manor Estate, are used for pheasant{shooting,}managed by a syndicate of residents & farmers. Grey squirrels & pigeons are also shot as they are pests. There is a{Cricket {Club,}1 tennis court for hire, & a few private courts & swimming pools.
